publicMethods.name: static fields
publicMethods.description: Create a new model fields definition.

publicMethods.name: static setRegistry
publicMethods.description: Set the attribute to the registry.

publicMethods.name: static clearBootedModels
publicMethods.description: Clear the list of booted models, so they can be re-booted.

publicMethods.name: static clearRegistries
publicMethods.description: Clear registries.

publicMethods.name: static newRawInstance
publicMethods.description: Create a new model instance without field values being populated.  This method is mainly for the internal use when registering models to the database. Since all pre-registered models are for referencing its model setting during the various process, but the fields are not required.  Use this method when you want create a new model instance for: - Registering model to a component (eg. Repository, Query, etc.) - Registering model to attributes (String, Has Many, etc.)

publicMethods.name: $self
publicMethods.description: Get the constructor for this model.

publicMethods.name: $entity
publicMethods.description: Get the entity for this model.

publicMethods.name: $primaryKey
publicMethods.description: Get the primary key for this model.

publicMethods.name: $fields
publicMethods.description: Get the model fields for this model.

publicMethods.name: $newInstance

params.name: attributes
params.description: data to fill new instance with

publicMethods.description: Create a new instance of this model. This method provides a convenient way to re-generate a fresh instance of this model. It's particularly useful during hydration through Query operations.

publicMethods.name: $fill

params.name: attributes
params.description: data to fill new instance with

publicMethods.description: Fill this model by the given attributes. Missing fields will be populated by the attributes default value.

publicMethods.name: $getKeyName
publicMethods.description: Get the primary key field name.

publicMethods.name: $getKey

params.name: record
params.description: optional data of element to get key

publicMethods.description: Get primary key value for the model. If the model has the composite key, it will return an array of ids.

publicMethods.name: $getIndexId

params.name: record
params.description: optional data of element to index id

publicMethods.description: Get the index id of this model or for a given record.

publicMethods.name: $getLocalKey
publicMethods.description: Get the local key name for the model.

publicMethods.name: $getRelation

params.name: name
params.description: name of relation to get instance

publicMethods.description: Get the relation instance for the given relation name.

publicMethods.name: $setRelation
publicMethods.description: Set the given relationship on the model.

publicMethods.name: $getAttributes
publicMethods.description: Get the serialized model attributes.

publicMethods.name: $toJson
publicMethods.description: Serialize this model, or the given model, as POJO.

publicMethods.name: $sanitize
publicMethods.description: Sanitize the given record. This method is similar to `$toJson` method, but the difference is that it doesn't instantiate the full model. The method is used to sanitize the record before persisting to the store.  It removes fields that don't exist in the model field schema or if the field is relationship fields.  Note that this method only sanitizes existing fields in the given record. It will not generate missing model fields. If you need to generate all model fields, use `$sanitizeAndFill` method instead.

publicMethods.name: $sanitizeAndFill
publicMethods.description: Same as `$sanitize` method, but it produces missing model fields with its default value.

publicProperties.name: static dataTypeCasting
publicProperties.description: Should or should not cast data types

publicProperties.name: static primaryKey
publicProperties.description: The primary key for the model.
